intro: Osmanthus ilicifolius var. myrtifolius, commonly known as the Chinese sweet osmanthus, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its fragrant, golden-yellow flowers that bloom in late autumn, releasing a sweet, spicy aroma. The leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a slightly serrated margin, providing a striking contrast to the flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, often found in forested areas. This plant is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its use in traditional Chinese medicine and as a source of aromatic oils.
